Description: Papyrus written with black ink with demotic legal text on recto (8 ll. of demotic and 3 ll. of Greek) and list of 8 witnesses on verso. Contract of sale and receipt for payment of tax. Thompson's MS Catalogue: "Sale of a share of a pastophorion in the temple of Hathor by Thotortais son of Nechtmin to Pa-Geb son of Patous. Date. year 16 Choiak 19 of Ptol. Alexander = BC. 98 Jan. 3." Concerning this group of texts, see entry for P BM EA 10491.
Curator's comments: Greek text published in P. Grenf. II 34. Cf. entry in www.trismegistos.org - DAHT. Edited in S.E. Thomas Cambridge PhD diss. Text 24 in Shore's Manuscript Catalogue of Demotic Gebelein Papyri in the British Museum. Publication in progress (S.E. Thomas).
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (1478) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/1478)
Condition: Papyrus Survey: Condition Details: Papyrus: fractured, insect attack, loss, cockled Black ink Tabbed: kraft paper Repaired: glassine paper Mount Details: Sandwich: glass Binding: leather (damaged) Object Priority: B Mount Priority: B Overall Condition: C Curatorial condition comment: fair
